intro: Clathrospermum biovulatum, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and along roadsides. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
